ageUke.name: Age Uke
ageUke.description: Age Uke (Rising Block) is a basic upward blocking technique used to defend against attacks to the face or upper body. The forearm moves upward to deflect the attack, while the other hand is pulled back to the hip in preparation for a counter-attack.

gedanBarai.name: Gedan Barai
gedanBarai.description: Gedan Barai (Downward Block) is a sweeping downward block that defends against low attacks. The arm moves in a downward arc to deflect strikes aimed at the lower body, while the other arm retracts to the hip position.

sotoUke.name: Soto Uke
sotoUke.description: Soto Uke (Outside Block) is an outward block used to deflect attacks coming from the inside to the outside. The forearm moves from the inside outward in a horizontal path to redirect the opponent's strike.
